required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the WallFlex™ Biliary Fully-covered Stent for the Palliative Treatment of Malignant Bile Duct Obstruction
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Single Arm, Prospective Study of the WallFlex™ Biliary Fully-covered Stent for the Palliative Treatment of Malignant Bile Duct Obstruction

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of this study is to assess the functionality of the WallFlex™ Biliary Fully-covered stent as a palliative treatment for malignant bile duct obstruction.

primary_outcome.measure: Adequate Clinical Palliation of the Biliary Obstruction
primary_outcome.description: Adequate clinical palliation of the biliary obstruction as demonstrated by the absence of stent occlusion within 6 month follow up or prior to death, whichever comes first in the evaluable subject cohort of 55 patients.

secondary_outcome.description: Technical success is defined as the ability to deploy the stent in satisfactory position across the stricture. It was assessed in the intent-to-treat cohort.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ability to Successfully Remove a Stent Upon Removal Attempt
secondary_outcome.description: The ability to successfully remove a stent upon a removal attempt was defined as removal without any clinically-significant complications or technical difficulties.
Per the study protocol, re-intervention was defined as any type of endoscopic, percutaneous, or surgical procedure to improve biliary drainage after insertion of the initial stent.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Success at 1 Month After Stent Procedure as Defined by Reduction of Biliary Obstruction Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success was defined as the reduction of biliary obstruction symptoms after treatment with the device.Symptoms included jaundice,pruritis,right upper quadrant abdominal pain,nausea,vomiting,fever and dark urine.For each patient,a total number of symptoms at baseline and at all post-treatment visits were recorded.Reduction in obstruction symptoms was defined as having a lower total number of symptoms at a post-treatment follow up visit compared to baseline.Here we report the number of subjects with a reduced total number of biliary obstructive symptoms at 1 month after stent treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Success at 3 Months After Stent Procedure as Defined by the Reduction of Biliary Obstruction Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success was defined as the reduction of biliary obstruction symptoms after treatment with the device.Symptoms included jaundice,pruritis,right upper quadrant abdominal pain,nausea,vomiting,fever and dark urine.For each patient,a total number of symptoms at baseline and at all post-treatment visits were recorded.Reduction in obstruction symptoms was defined as having a lower total number of symptoms at a post-treatment follow up visit compared to baseline.Here we report the number of subjects with a reduced total number of biliary obstructive symptoms at 3 months after stent treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Clinical Success at 6 Months After Stent Procedure as Defined by the Reduction of Biliary Obstruction Symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical success was defined as the reduction of biliary obstruction symptoms after treatment with the device.Symptoms included jaundice,pruritis,right upper quadrant abdominal pain,nausea,vomiting,fever and dark urine.For each patient,a total number of symptoms at baseline and at all post-treatment visits were recorded.Reduction in obstruction symptoms was defined as having a lower total number of symptoms at a post-treatment follow up visit compared to baseline.Here we report the number of subjects with a reduced total number of biliary obstructive symptoms at 6 months after stent treatment.

Total bilirubin levels at 1 month follow-up were compared to initial bilirubin levels. Bilirubin level reduction was defined as total bilirubin levels being below 3mg/dl, or reduced by >30% if the initial baseline value was greater than 3mg/dl.

Per the protocol, stent patency was defined as lack of obstructive symptoms and/or a total bilirubin level of less than 3mg/dl. Patency evaluations at the Month 1 visit were done on those patients with both a total bilirubin level and assessment of biliary obstructive symptoms.

Per the protocol, stent patency was defined as lack of obstructive symptoms and/or a normal total bilirubin level. Patency evaluations at Month 3 were done on those patients with an assessment of biliary obstructive symptoms (bilirubin levels were not measured at Month 3).

Per the protocol, stent patency was defined as lack of obstructive symptoms and/or a normal total bilirubin level. Patency evaluations at Month 6 were done on those patients with an assessment of biliary obstructive symptoms (bilirubin levels were not measured at Month 6).
Time to stent occlusion(measured in days since stent placement) was recorded for any subjects who experienced occlusion.

Adverse Events reported during the trial were evaluated for their device-and procedure-relatedness and severity in order to assess device safety. An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurance in a study participant.

arm_group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

intervention.intervention_name: WallFlex™ Biliary Fully Covered Metal Stent placement
intervention.description: Implantable metal biliary stent intended for use in the palliative treatment of biliary strictures produced by malignant neoplasms. The stent is fully covered with a polymer to reduce the potential for tumor ingrowth into the stent.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 or older
- Clinical symptoms of biliary obstruction
- Inoperable extrahepatic biliary obstruction by any malignant process
- Willing and able to comply with the study procedures and provide written informed consent to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participation in an Investigational Study within 90 days prior to date of patient consent
- Strictures that cannot be dilated enough to pass the delivery system
- Perforation of any duct within the biliary tree
- Presence of a metal biliary stent
- Presence of any esophageal or duodenal stent
- Patients for whom endoscopic procedures are contraindicated
- Patients with known sensitivity to any components of the stent or delivery system
- Patients with active hepatitis or intrahepatic metastases that extensively involves both lobes of the liver
- Patients with an anticipated life expectancy of < 3 months

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent
group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

participants_list.participants: 74 enrolled patients(signed an Informed Consent Form)were screened.58 were eligible(intent to treat)
55 out of 58 patients were evaluable(had a stent placed and had at least 1 week of follow up)

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Treated and later found to be ineligible

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent
group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

outcome.title: Adequate Clinical Palliation of the Biliary Obstruction
outcome.description: Adequate clinical palliation of the biliary obstruction as demonstrated by the absence of stent occlusion within 6 month follow up or prior to death, whichever comes first in the evaluable subject cohort of 55 patients.
outcome.population: Per protocol, assessment of the primary endpoint was performed on the evaluable cohort, defined as group of patients who signed the Informed Consent Form, met eligibility criteria, received a stent and had at least one week of follow up.

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent
group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

measure.title: Adequate Clinical Palliation of the Biliary Obstruction
measure.description: Adequate clinical palliation of the biliary obstruction as demonstrated by the absence of stent occlusion within 6 month follow up or prior to death, whichever comes first in the evaluable subject cohort of 55 patients.
measure.population: Per protocol, assessment of the primary endpoint was performed on the evaluable cohort, defined as group of patients who signed the Informed Consent Form, met eligibility criteria, received a stent and had at least one week of follow up.

outcome.title: Technical Success
outcome.description: Technical success is defined as the ability to deploy the stent in satisfactory position across the stricture. It was assessed in the intent-to-treat cohort.
outcome.population: Device Safety and Technical Success were evaluated for the 58 intent-to-treat patients

measure.title: Technical Success

outcome.title: Ability to Successfully Remove a Stent Upon Removal Attempt
outcome.description: The ability to successfully remove a stent upon a removal attempt was defined as removal without any clinically-significant complications or technical difficulties.
outcome.population: 2 patients of the evaluable cohort (n=55) were assessed for success of stent removal without any complications/technical difficulties.

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent
group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

outcome.title: Re-interventions
outcome.description: Per the study protocol, re-intervention was defined as any type of endoscopic, percutaneous, or surgical procedure to improve biliary drainage after insertion of the initial stent.
outcome.population: The re-intervention rate was assessed in the evaluable cohort of 55 patients.

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent

outcome.title: Clinical Success at 1 Month After Stent Procedure as Defined by Reduction of Biliary Obstruction Symptoms
outcome.description: Clinical success was defined as the reduction of biliary obstruction symptoms after treatment with the device.Symptoms included jaundice,pruritis,right upper quadrant abdominal pain,nausea,vomiting,fever and dark urine.For each patient,a total number of symptoms at baseline and at all post-treatment visits were recorded.Reduction in obstruction symptoms was defined as having a lower total number of symptoms at a post-treatment follow up visit compared to baseline.Here we report the number of subjects with a reduced total number of biliary obstructive symptoms at 1 month after stent treatment.
outcome.population: 49 out of 55 evaluable subjects reached the 1-Month Follow Up visit and were evaluated for reduction of biliary obstruction symptoms.

outcome.title: Bilirubin Level Reduction
outcome.description: Total bilirubin levels at 1 month follow-up were compared to initial bilirubin levels. Bilirubin level reduction was defined as total bilirubin levels being below 3mg/dl, or reduced by >30% if the initial baseline value was greater than 3mg/dl.
outcome.population: 45 out of 55 evaluable patients reported a baseline and a Month 1 total bilirubin level and were therefore analyzed for bilirubin levels reduction.

group.title: WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered Stent
group.description: Single arm, biliary stenting, using WallFlex Biliary Fully Covered stent

measure.title: Bilirubin Level Reduction
measure.description: Total bilirubin levels at 1 month follow-up were compared to initial bilirubin levels. Bilirubin level reduction was defined as total bilirubin levels being below 3mg/dl, or reduced by >30% if the initial baseline value was greater than 3mg/dl.
measure.population: 45 out of 55 evaluable patients reported a baseline and a Month 1 total bilirubin level and were therefore analyzed for bilirubin levels reduction.

outcome.title: Stent Patency at 1 Month
outcome.description: Per the protocol, stent patency was defined as lack of obstructive symptoms and/or a total bilirubin level of less than 3mg/dl. Patency evaluations at the Month 1 visit were done on those patients with both a total bilirubin level and assessment of biliary obstructive symptoms.
outcome.population: 45 out of 55 evaluable patients had both bilirubin and obstructive symptom assessment at Month 1.

outcome.title: Time to Stent Occlusion
outcome.description: Time to stent occlusion(measured in days since stent placement) was recorded for any subjects who experienced occlusion.
outcome.population: Only 1 subject experienced stent occlusion during the study.

measure.title: Time to Stent Occlusion
measure.description: Time to stent occlusion(measured in days since stent placement) was recorded for any subjects who experienced occlusion.
measure.population: Only 1 subject experienced stent occlusion during the study.

outcome.title: Number of Device-Related Adverse Events
outcome.description: Adverse Events reported during the trial were evaluated for their device-and procedure-relatedness and severity in order to assess device safety. An adverse event was defined as any untoward medical occurance in a study participant.
outcome.population: The intent-to-treat cohort of 58 patients was used for this analysis. Of all the events reported for this population, only 6 events were reported as device-related.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
